title: 106_s1770
content: The "Clear Extenders Act of 1999" is cited as the short title. Amendments to the 1986 Code are referenced in the Act. The table of contents includes the extension of expiring incentives, such as the permanent extension of the research and development credit. The "Clear Extenders Act of 1999" includes amendments to the 1986 Code, such as the removal of subsection (h) in Section 41 and the amendment of Section 45C(b)(1). Additionally, there is an increase in percentages under the Alternative Incremental Credit in Section 41(c)(4). These changes apply to amounts paid or incurred after June 30, 1999. The amendments made by the "Clear Extenders Act of 1999" apply to taxable years starting after June 30, 1999. A special rule states that the credit under section 41 of the Internal Revenue Code attributable to the suspension period from July 1, 1999, to September 30, 2000, cannot be used before October 1, 2000. Expedited refunds are allowed for this credit. Expedited refunds can be applied for by taxpayers for overpayments of tax due to the "Clear Extenders Act of 1999". Applications must be filed before October 1, 2001, and adjustments will be allowed within 90 days of filing. For overpayments, the amount is determined and applied or refunded similar to section 6411(b) of the Code. Consolidated returns follow section 6411(c) provisions. Credits during a suspension period are determined under section 41 of the Code. The amount of credit for a taxable year during a suspension period is calculated based on the ratio of months in the suspension period to the total months in the year. No estimated tax penalties will be imposed before July 1, 1999, for underpayments due to this calculation. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. SEC. 102 extends minimum tax relief for individuals for calendar years 1998, 1999, 2000, and 2001. Child credit amendments apply until December 31, 2001. Effective date is for taxable years after December 31, 1998. SEC. 103 exempts active financing income from Subpart F. SEC. 103 amends Sections 953(e)(10) and 954(h)(9) regarding active financing income exemption. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 1999. SEC. 104 sets a taxable income limit on percentage depletion for marginal production. SEC. 104 amends the taxable income limit on percentage depletion for marginal production, changing the effective date to January 1, 2002. SEC. 105 extends the Work Opportunity Credit and Welfare-to-Work Credit until December 31, 2001, clarifies the first year of employment, and applies to individuals starting work after June 30, 1999. SEC. 201 modifies the estimated tax safe harbor for 1999 and 2000 in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment made in 1999 applies to installment payments for taxable years starting after December 31, 1999.
